The function \( y = \sin\left(\frac{1}{x}\right) \) has x-intercepts where \( \sin\left(\frac{1}{x}\right) = 0 \), which occurs when \( \frac{1}{x} = n\pi \) for integers \( n \). Thus, \( x = \frac{1}{n\pi} \). For \( x \) in \( (0.0001, 0.001) \), we have \( 1000 < n\pi < 10000 \), leading to \( n \) ranging from 319 to 3183. The number of integers in this range is \( 3183 - 319 + 1 = 2865 \).

**Answer:** The number of x-intercepts is \boxed{2865}.
